intro: Siphoneugena baporeti, commonly known as the Bornean siphonostele, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to the trunks of trees in its natural habitat. Its botanical features include a slender stem, waxy foliage, and distinctive white or pale pink blooms that appear during the rainy season. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
